title: Multi-Dataset Synergistic in Supervised Learning to Pre-Label Structural Components in Point Clouds from Shell Construction Scenes
author: Lukas Rauch (Institute of Structural Engineering University of the Bundeswehr Munich), Thomas Braml (Institute of Structural Engineering University of the Bundeswehr Munich)
background: This paper focuses on semantic segmentation of point clouds from construction sites, aiming to automate the annotation process for structural components.
contribution: This study introduces a multi-dataset training strategy to improve the segmentation of construction-specific components in point clouds, achieving noteworthy segmentation performance with limited new data.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods typically focused on residential and furnished environments, limiting their applicability in construction settings with complex components.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work leverages existing datasets alongside a custom construction dataset to optimize model training and enhance generalization for different environments.

key_innovation: Combines multiple heterogeneous datasets for a more robust training process in a specialized domain, facilitating automated pre-labeling of new point clouds.
real_world_impact: The proposed methodology could significantly expedite the annotation process in construction projects, improving the efficiency of site management and operational safety.
limitations: The validation is primarily based on a single building type, limiting generalizability to other construction scenarios.

new_terms.point cloud: **Point cloud** refers to a set of data points in space produced by 3D scanning technologies, representing the external surface of an object or environment.
new_terms.semantic segmentation: **Semantic segmentation** is a computer vision task that involves classifying each pixel or point in an image or point cloud into predefined categories.
